comment: This is a simple class, but there is a lot of reading, and assignments to go with the readings. Do not fall behind, and prioritize the readings and try to understand the texts, even if you need to use other sources to get the idea. The books were all pretty interesting, but slow at points. Overall a simple class, as long as you manage it well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Washington cares whether you pass or not and will give extra help if you need it.  She is respectful of her students, and, for me, took the terror out of this writing class!  At the end of the semester I felt like I really could write!

She made it simple and easy for an online class. Her assignments consisted of weekly simple assignments, only 3 essays (which she gave enough time to complete), and 3 essay feedback assignments. Overall, this course was very simple and an easy A!!

For an online class it was super easy to follow. She gave great feedback on essays and she was easy to reach out to. Doing peer review online is challenging but she made it easy to contact people which was a plus.

Dr. Washington was fantastic, her class schedule was really easy to follow and she was able to answer any questions I had outside of class. She even offered an extra credit opportunity. By far one of my favorite teachers this semester please take her!!!
Great professor.

Dr. Lynn Washington is by far one of the best teachers at KSU. She understand students and their situations and she tries her best to help in any situation. Her quizzes are extremely easy. This class is an easy A!

Would take her again! Her work is super simple and easy. Sometimes it was doubled the work, but it was always simple. She can be slow at grading sometimes. Easy A if you just do the work assigned. She does not grade super hard, as long as you try and show effort, you'll receive an A.

Definitely would take her again! the work itself is very double and she is not a hard grader as long as you put in the effort. Doesn't respond to emails that often nor gives feedback on essays. Super sweet if you needed help and tried to make the online class fun! Sad I wasn't able to get her for ENGL 1102 but will miss her course! Take her !!

She lost a point because she is terrible at communicating, you can't see the coursework before drop/add ends, and you're only given a week for midterm/finals. Almost all of her quizzes can be found on Quizlet and they aren't on lockdown. The assignments are hard, but you just have to submit something and you will do well.
Professor Washington is a great professor. She grades a little slow, but it doesn't hinder any work that you have in the future. Take her if she is available!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Easy, laidback Composition I class. Dr. Washington was sometimes slow to grade assignments and her online materials were at times disorganized or not updated. There were about 4 papers and other minor assignments such as discussions, peer reviews, and writing exercises. Easy A if you do the readings and homework.
Not a bad class to take, lots of reading material and a group project. No lockdown browser or webcam. Not the fastest at answering questions through emailing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Bi-weekly Assignments consist of quizzes/discussions/ writing activities. You have two weeks to do them but you can finish it in one. Not harsh with grading. Only con is the professor isn't always accessible and may take long to respond to your emails. The readings were interesting as well!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take this class if youre looking for a more laidback experience. We had 3 essays, 7 writing assignments, 4 discussion posts and 3 peer review assignments. It sounds like a lot but we were given two weeks to complete 3-4 assignments. My only complaint is that the feedback given on essays was vague. Overall, class is an easy A and a nice professor!

Super sweet and wants you to do well, so she's lenient with due dates. There's a module every two weeks that consists of a couple quizzes (answers on quizlet), a discussion post (sometimes with a response to other posts), and a writing assignment. People who complain about her are just lazy and not ready for a strict professor who will tell them no

Her class focused more on writing essays than anything else. There were 3-4 essays to be written, each a different style. It starts with a Narrative and ends with a Research Paper. She would respond to emails at different speeds every time. It would be either the same day or around a week after. Even though she was hard to reach, she was great!
You do have to read a little bit, but she is a great porfessor. Super nice and very responsive. She's very understanding and willing to help if you just talk to her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: extremely easy. The only thing that kind of sucks is she doesn't give clear instructions, but she is very laid-back and nonchalant. I can't say I've learned anything but I got an A.

Washington is super easy. She has modules due every two weeks (which could all be completed in a few hours in a day) and she does not lock down any quizzes. A few papers, but that's it. Reading is apart of the class, but all answers can be found on the internet. Take her if you have a busy schedule and want this class as a break.

Dr Washington is great. This is the easiest class ever. The instructions could be a bit confusing at times but shes always willing to answer any questions. Few essays and other assignments which she gives 2 weeks for. Only thing is that she doesnt give feedback on essays but take her for an easy A.

Some of the assignments/quizzes are extremely easy, however, some of the assignments are a massive headache. The questions she asks for some assignments are terrible and nearly impossible to respond/relate to. There is a research essay, group project, and cultural essay all due at end of semester. Would take different prof. if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: One of Kennesaw's best! I have her now online for English 1102 and she's an easy grader. If you do the work you'll get an A. She gives 2 weeks to do assignments and they're really easy; things as simple as a discussion post or a rough draft. She typically responds to emails within 48hrs. I would definitely take her again! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!!

Great class, didnt really have any interaction with her but the class was easy. Assignments every week, very short as well as the weekly quizzes. One group project, one final exam essay, and one cultural response paper. Given pretty much the entire semester to do those three.

Take her if you want an easy A. Took her online class and got an A. There are small assignments due every week but I got 100 on them. Quizzes on quizlet. Easy grader. Dont buy the book, just type "(The story of the week) pdf"
Very nice professor, she is laid back and, easy grader. It takes a while to get back grades, but if you do the assignments you should get an A. I definitely recommend you take her class.

I didn't learn a single thing in this class. She shows up late if she comes at all. She talks about random stuff for 30 minutes and then just lets us go. There's no structure. It's a waste of time. She's a super lax grader so it's easy to pass but it's obvious that she doesn't care about teaching at all.

Online class, there are 8 modules and each contain simple quizzes you can find online, easy discussion post, and a couple of assignment that arent hard. There is a group project and a final paper as well as a cultural experience paper which are all easy. Takes long to get grades in, but doesnt grade harsh SUPER EASY GRADER. easy easy online class.

I was very excited for this class given the positive reviews I read. However, this class was entirely a waste of time, no thorough assignments, no beneficial conversations, and no substance at all. If you are looking for an easy A this is a great class, but if you want to learn I would avoid it. Though this semester could be an outlier for her...

She is an amazing professor. If you don't get an A, you probably didn't turn anything in. She grades very easy and will reopen assignments you did not finish FOR FULL CREDIT. Assignment are not graded quickly, but she normally gives you an A if you understood the topic. Two easy papers and a group project. Easy quizzes and some discussions.

She is a pretty good teacher. It takes a VERY long time for grades to be put in which can be a little stressful but she usually gives you a 100 if you did everything she asked (which isn't much). She opens up all modules at the end of the semester to allow everyone to go back and finish assignments they didn't already do.

Take her class!! I took her over the summer and each week we had a couple SUPER easy quizzes and I discussion post. At the end of the semester we had 2 essays and a group project but she is a super easy grader and unless you dont do your work, you will get an A!

Took this course in the summer, she is hard to reach out of class and never replies to emails. She's kind of unorganized as she is frequently late. We had 3 papers, 2 weeks for 5 and 10 page, one week for 7. You should probably take her for a full semester, not summer unless you can write papers fast, and textbook only used twice for a grade.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you don't get an A in this class you probably didn't do your work. She takes some time to grade papers, but I didn't stress over it. She's an easy grader.
If you don't get an A in this class you probably didn't do your work.

If you do your work you will get an A! MOST of the class is pretty easy and self-explanatory. It is not hard. That being said, if you need to get in contact with her, good luck. She has a busy schedule, so it takes her a few weeks to respond because of this she is very easy going. Group project, two big essays make up most of the grade!

I took Professor Washington for online English 1102 and she was beyond amazing. I am a law student so my course load is FULL. She replies to emails almost immediately! You have a quiz if I remember every single week, THE QUIZES ARE WORD FOR WORD HER NOTES. She also, at the end, has your one and only paper due..5 pages. TAKE HER YOU WILL GET AN A!!

Mrs. Washington was very clear on what she wanted with the papers. I took the hybrid class and the "off day" assignments were straight forward just had to do them. Take her for 1101 and 1102 and you will get an A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: While her class is easy, I found her to be a little unorganized. Sometimes she would show up late or not at all. However, she did allow us extra time on assignments, and as long as you paid attention to her lectures, you were bound to pass the tests. She does try to encourage class discussion on the books so make sure to engage or you'll regret it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is amazing and passionate about what she does! I loved her class so much because she was willing to work with us and give us some wiggle room when it came to assignments. All of her assignments, quizzes, and tests were online so that was definitely a plus for me. I couldn't have asked for a better professor.

If you're looking for an easy english class to take take Washington!!! Theres a few essays and a few assignments on d2l that are so easy. She isn't the best about giving feedback or grading things in a timely matter but she gave extra credit multiple times because she didn't grade essays soon enough. I took hybrid and it was so easy
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Washington is an EXCELLENT professor!!! She is very knowledgeable and keeps you engaged. She is understanding and works with her student so they succeed. The test and quizzes are online and you usually have multiple attempts. Out of all the class Ive taken during my college career her class was the most interesting and educational.

Awesome! Very understanding if you miss an assignment but does require you to come to class- good thing is however that she often finishes the lesson then cuts class short. Four papers leading up to one research paper, simple and clear, great teacher.
Great presenter, cares about what she's doing and engages the class consistently. Would defiantly take her class again.
Dr. Washington is amazing. She assigns clear papers that lead up to one large, accumulative paper and project. Also, make sure you have the two books for the class!

Out of all the tags the best describe her the one that stands out the most is "there for you", due to my own faults I missed a lot of quizzes and assignments she assigns online. At the end of the semester I realized if I didn't make a certain grade in the class I would lose a scholarship but she worked with me to make sure I got the grade I needed.

There are no tests, only papers. She was clear on what she wanted in an essay and (if I asked) she was great at giving feedback for what I need to work on for the next paper. Don't hold your breath for a grade from her; she takes forever to grade essays.

Nothing but good vibes with Dr. Washington. She is literally the chillest professor EVER. Not to mention so nice and a likeable person. Shes young and likes to assign interesting topics to write about. I was so scared to take english because I am horrible at writing papers but her class was awesome and made me like English better.

Four papers, and a few in class assignments. Papers are well spread out through the semester. Barely used the textbook, I never bought any of them, just looked on with other people. She is very nice, and understands that you have a life outside of school. Is very student oriented and lets you lead the class most of the time.
She is awesome. EVERYONE TAKE HER

She is a great teacher, pretty lenient, lets you make decisions in the class. She does get off track pretty simply though. It does get difficult to keep up with what is important for tests and what isn't important.

Without a doubt my favorite professor. I actually enjoy and look forward to going to her class. Very laid back, funny, understanding, and treats you like a person instead of a student; all very rare qualities in a professor. Aiming to get her class for 1102 as well.

Ms. Washington is by far one of my favorite teachers at KSU. I took her 1101 class and am currently finishing up her 1102 class. She is very understanding and explains exactly what she expects for your papers. There are only 4 papers and occasional in class writing assignments which benefit you and prepare you for your upcoming assignment. TAKE HER

If the class isn't full and you have the chance, take Ms. Washington. She is extremely laid back and is very understanding. If you actually want to have a good experience in lit at KSU, you should definitely take her for both 1101 an 1102.

I took Ms. Washington for eng1101 and I'm currently in her 1102 class. She is the most laid back teacher I have ever had, no tests or quizzes. You have 4 papers which aren't even bad. She funny and really sweet. Doesn't give hw. If you want a laid back english class, take her!!
